snippet.title: Veteran reporter Laurie Oakes to retire
snippet.content: Canberra press gallery veteran Laurie Oakes is set to retire after a career spanning more than 50 years reporting on Australian politics. The Channel Nine reporter and three-time Walkley Award-winner will sign off for the last time from television screens on August 18, a few days after his 74th birthday. "The story that caused the biggest stink, I suppose, was in 1980 when the entire budget was leaked to me two days before then treasurer John Howard was due to deliver it," Oakes told the Nine News website. (C) AAP 2017
